meanings.definition: Feel or show deep sorrow or regret for someone's death.
meanings.sent1: She will mourn her pet's passing for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered to mourn the loss of their beloved grandmother.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed to mourn the absence of its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to mourn the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The old tree seemed to mourn the loss of its leaves in the autumn breeze.

meanings.sent1: He will mourn his friend's passing deeply.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to mourn the loss of a respected leader.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to mourn the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to mourn the fallen leaves carried away by the current.
meanings.sent5: The violin's melody seemed to mourn the end of the concert.

meanings.definition: Express or feel sorrow or regret.
meanings.sent1: She will mourn the missed opportunity for a long time.
meanings.sent2: He mourned his mistake and tried to make amends.
meanings.sent3: The child seemed to mourn the lost balloon floating away.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to mourn the absence of the rustling leaves.
meanings.sent5: The painting seemed to mourn the lack of vibrant colors.
